ygData.subject: Re: mip = many innapropriate pictures?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I have 128MB.  I watched it carefully again last night, and got the delay once *without* hitting the hard drive, so something else is going on.  Maybe it s
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 28 Feb 2000, Steven S. Klug wrote:
>
> What you are seeing is definitely texture loading delays.
> EQ really likes to have at least 128MB to run with no
> swapping. When you're running with only (God, when did it
> become ONLY?) 64MB, as I do on my home system, it goes to
> the HD, because the textures are loaded in virtual memory,

I have 128MB. I watched it carefully again last night, and
got the delay once *without* hitting the hard drive, so
something else is going on. Maybe it's just psychology and me
not being used to any frame rate lower than 20 fps. :)

> of texture data). It also seems that this mouse jump
> problem is more prevalent if you have a USB mouse,

PS/2 mouse. (And yes, I've tried increasing the sampling
rate.)

As for why I don't turn mouse acceleration off, I tried that.
EQ's mouse settings seem to override your Windows destop
settings.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
